H0.text: Texture is the characteristic of the soil sample that the student described as “very gritty.”

H1.text: Hardness is the characteristic of the soil that the student described when identifying a soil sample as “very gritty.”

H2.text: Organic content is the characteristic of the soil that the student described as “very gritty.”

H3.text: Water retention is the characteristic of the soil that the student described when he identified the soil sample as “very gritty.”

A4.text: Soils that have a high percentage of sand, such as sandy loam or sandy clay, have a gritty texture.

A5.text: Fine textured soils generally have a higher capacity for water retention, whereas sandy soils contain large pore spaces that allow leaching.
